messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How cold does it get this Friday?
Sure—could you let me know which location you’re interested in (e.g., city or ZIP/postal code)? And when you say “this Friday,” do you mean the next upcoming Friday on the calendar?
Could you please specify the location you’re interested in (for example, a city name or ZIP/postal code)? That way I can look up the expected low temperature for this Friday.

I’m sorry, but I need to know the location you’re interested in (for example, a city name, ZIP/postal code, or latitude/longitude) in order to look up the forecast for this Friday. Could you provide any of those details?
I'm not sure where exactly. Can you use your tools to figure it out?

I’m afraid I don’t have any automatic way to detect your location. To pull up a Friday low-temperature forecast, I still need at least one of the following:

• A city name (e.g., “Seattle”)  
• A ZIP/postal code  
• Latitude and longitude coordinates  

Could you provide any one of those?
Unfortunately, I really can't give any specific data.

I’m sorry, but without at least a general location (city, ZIP/postal code, or latitude/longitude), I can’t look up a weather forecast for this Friday. If you’d like, you can tell me even just the country or state you’re in, or check a local weather service and let me know the place—you don’t need to get more specific than that. Let me know how you’d like to proceed!
